A short drive to Huntingdon Beach which was great as the Surfing Championships were being held there during our stay. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms nicely equipped. The staff were great and so helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Loved it and such fantstic value for money.

I've been here multiple times and every time I come back I remember why, The place is great. The service is top notch. Every one eager to assist you to the best that they can. The rooms are great very clean. If your looking for your home away from home, this is deffinately the place to go.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent staywith us.   Your opinion is very important to us. By telling us what you liked or disliked about your stay is how we are constantly able to improve. This helps the entire staff deliver a superior experience for all our future guests. We hope you will come back and see us again very soon.  If I can be of assistance in the future, please don't hesitate to contact me at 714-898-4043 .  Thank you again for taking the time to complete the survey. We appreciate your loyalty to our brand.  Sincerely,  Laurie Hill General Manager BEST WESTERN Westminster Inn

Summary: I've been stay at this motel for many years. Why the management are very friendly and will asstist you in what ever the matters or concers you have. The rooms are very comfortable, great court yard with a pretty rose garden by the pool area. Good place to bring your family. Cost of rooms are very resonable for the area. The motel is centally located for Disney or the ocean plus conveinate to John Wayne and Long Beach airports. They have a BBQ grill and a picnic tale in the court yard free to use. Many people uses it all the time just clean uo your mess. It's great exspecialy if you are tired of eating out all the time. Great place come and stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. hope to see you again soon.

Summary: There are two Best Western hotels in Westminster.  This one is located near the Naval Weapons station.  From I-405 it is west on Westminster Blvd. at the end of the commercial district just as the housing development starts.  Our room was 203 on the second floor.  We arrived very late and got up after breakfast, so we cannot comment on the food.  It was surprisingly quiet and we got a much needed good night's sleep.  While there was AC, we didn't turn it on - instead we opened the windows which face the back of the property and a very quiet neighborhood.  Bed was comfortable, linens were good.  Very, very clean, except curtains need dry cleaning.  Bathroom was large and nicely refurbished.  Hair dryer, iron and ironing board in closet. Complimentary water bottles.  Large flat

Summary Heading: Okay for the price - Upgrade if you can
Summary: I stayed at this hotel this past Friday and I have to say it is not quite what I was expecting after reading all the rave reviews.  I am not a hotel snob and I have stayed in $23 rooms in old  town Vegas up to very pricey rooms in New York.  I just hate it when I take the time to research all hotels and then am let down once I arrive.  I booked a 2-queen NON-smoking room and was given a top floor room nearest the street.  As soon as we opened the door we were hit with the smoke smell.  We called down to the front desk and she did apologize and brought us Febreeze to try and mask the smell.  We were leaving to the mall anyways so we sprayed every bit of that room and then cranked the air conditioner.  When we got back, the room was very cold but at least the smell had lightened a

Summary Heading: Excellent basic property, great staff and clean
Summary: This property is not fancy, but it is very well taken care of.  The owner is the manager and cares about his guests.  My experience was very positive.  The shower, bed, TV, and internet were excellent.  If you look at other properties comparable nearby, either they will be dumps or over $100 for a king.  An $85 rate is reasonable this close to the beach.

I really didn't expect too much when I booked this hotel; however, I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very comfortable, the grounds were well tended, the breakfast was good and the personnel very pleasant and more than willing to help in any way possible.  I have now stayed here two times and have been more than satisfied. Eileen
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent staywith us.   Your opinion is very important to us. By telling us what you liked or disliked about your stay is how we are constantly able to improve. This helps the entire staff deliver a superior experience for all our future guests. We hope you will come back and see us again very soon.  If I can be of assistance in the future, please don't hesitate to contact me at 714-898-4043 .  Thank you again for taking the time to complete the survey. We appreciate your loyalty to our brand.  Sincerely,  Laurie Hill General Manager BEST WESTERN Westminster Inn

Summary Heading: Best Place I have stayed at in awhile
Summary: When I first arrived I looked at this place and thought "oh no, what did I get myself into"? I went inside and was greated by the nicest front desk person. She told me where I could get something to eat after my long trip. She then had another employee take my bag up to my room since there is no elevator and my bag was heavy. Once again I looked at the front door and thought I had made a mistake. Boy was that first impression wrong. Inside my room was beautiful. The room was exceptionally clean. I had a large king sized bed with a 40 inch flat screen TV. The bathroom had all new fixtures. Down stairs and toward the back was a heated pool and hot tub. Both very clean. I found they allowed animals too as some people had brought their dogs on vacation. In the morning they had a

We stayed for four nights in May, 2012.  The rooms are comfortable. It was centrally located for our needs...close enough to the beaches and to Disneyland.  The breakfast has bagels, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, waffles, coffee, tea, and juice.....so anyone can find something to eat.  I would certainly stay again!

Doesn't look look much from outside, but the rooms, bath and vanity are big.  Inside room, 2 easy chairs and 2 desk chairs.  Patio in back thru slider.  Breakfast has waffles, HB eggs, toast, juice, etc.  About 500 yards from 405 freeway.  Pleasant hotel, good staff.  About $80 plus tax.

Outside looks just OK, but rooms are very comfortable and staff goes out of their way to help.  Very clean with no off odors.  Laundry is available.  The breakfast is much better than standard with waffles, boiled eggs, yogurt, etc.  Location is convenient to several interstates if you want a home base for wide ranging explorations.  Very interesting Mexican grocery one block to the east.  There are paperback books on the mantle in the lobby that you can swap if you have finished your book.
I have stayed here on many occasions.I never have any problems.The rooms are great and the service has always been outstanding.IF your in the area I highly recommend this hotel.I know I will be back.

I didnt expect some of the niceties at this price. #1 surprise was the friendly staff. The bed was perfectly comfortable and I had a full night's homely even the first time I made a reservation at this hotel. The breakfast was another unexpected treat and hit the spot. I look forward to it even though I am not a breakfast person. Nice coffee too. I have now stayed at this hotel several times over the past 3 months, traveling between coasts frequently. The hotel is located just off a busy part of OC, which is nice because I remain well connected and have lots of options for food and entertainment in the area. Looking forward to my next visit.

The reviews that gave this place the high marks must have come from friends and family of the owner because this place is a dump.  We decided to stay here based on the good reviews and what a mistake it turned out to be.  The motel is located on a very busy and noisy street.  You can hear the noise in your room regardless of which way the window is facing.  The beds are horrible.  We had a room with 2 Queen beds and both had springs sticking out of the mattresses. We didn't sleep for most of the night.  The floor in the room is filthy so you have to keep your shoes on the whole time.  The services is the worst.  We arrived at 3:30 in the afternoon and were told that our room was not ready even though their check in time is 1PM.  Even though we had a standard reservation the

Summary Heading: Good, basic place to stay close to the beach
Summary: I made last-minute reservations here after I decided that camping at Joshua Tree in July was a bad idea. I stayed for two nights. The price was reasonable, the room was clean and the breakfast in the morning was good. The night manager was friendly and helpful when I came in and assured me about security as well as provided me with information about what to do in the area. It's only a 10-minute drive to Seal Beach from here, or you can go down the PCH towards Huntington Beach.   Oh, and I didn't use it, but they had an amazing look pool with pretty good hours.

Our clean room had two queen beds, a microwave, and a refrigerator that was controlled by a wall switch labeled ‚Äúfridge‚Äù. It would have been better to also note something on the fridge itself, as it didn‚Äôt seem to work at first. The bed was comfortable. Storage space was ample. There is no coin operated laundry here. The continental breakfast was so-so, not as good as the BW Orange Plaza had. This BW had a nice outdoor courtyard with not only a swimming pool and chairs, but also a ping pong table, grill, and picnic tables
The title says it all. I can't wait to see all the Christmas lights I see the staff putting up.
Easily put awesome hotel & great service!!! Will def visit again soon!
The staff was very friendly, and quick to give me anything I may need to make me feel at home.  The breakfast was hot and ready to go when I woke up!

Summary Heading: I stayed with my family and it was the best
Summary: Me and my family stayed at this motel on vacation its the best

I just stayed at this hotel last week for business and it was a great experience; I will definitely come back! The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. An added bonus was the delicious free continental breakfast! Can't beat this hotel for convenience to SoCal destinations, price and cleanliness.

Stayed here three weekends to help cut the driving time to my class.  Every weekend the staff greeted me pleasantly and the room never disappointed.  After grueling 6 hour classes it was great to be able to come back to a clean and comfortable room to relax and prepare for the next day.  Thank you everyone at the Best Western who helped make my stay incredibly excellent!
Small community with Large rooms.. Friendly owner and great staff. The best hot continental breakfast ever. Will stay again and definately recommend.

Upon check-in the staff was very pleasant and friendly. She was very helpful with any questions we had. Our room was very clean and comfortable with a private patio. Our stay at Best Western Westminister Inn met all the expectations we had and we would definitely return for another stay.

Summary Heading: Don't judge a hotel by it's price!
Summary: Don't judge a hotel by it's price. This hotel exceed all standards of a high class more expensive hotel. The front desk staff is your first impression and she was more than welcoming. The rooms are super nice ad the beds are comfy as well. We didn't have a chance to use the pool or spa but it was packed so that tell you something. No parking fee and complementary breakfast. You can't beat it! Planning on staying here in the future!

Clean, front desk was very helpful and friendly, the ony thing bad was it was suppose to be non smoking and the room smelled like smoke, it even had burn marks on the carpet.  They offered to move us but the only room avail was one with a handicap bathroom and I didn't want to take that away from someone that might need it.

We checked in last summer (in June 2011) and the front desk couldn't find our reservation. It took them 30 minutes to figure it out. When they gave us a key card to the room, we walked into a room full of someone else's stuff. THEY GAVE US A ROOM THAT WAS ALREADY OCCUPIED! When I went down to the front desk to tell them this, they questioned me and didn't believe me until they realized they goofed.   I will not be coming back to this place again.

My girlfriend and I had a great stay at this place. We got a room on the   second floor, although the room looked like it overlooked a parking lot, i   was surprised to find that the view was actually of a pool and greens all   around. The room was very very clean, clean linens, 32 inch lcd with a   dvd player, and it had a hairdryer too. Personally all i cared about was   keeping her happy, and this place didnt make my life harder than it   already is, thanks alot best western of westminster for your hospitality.

The staff at this property is friendly and very polite. They go beyond there need to meet the customers expectations. It was a real pleasure to see a smile every time we came across the employees. The check in and check out was quick and problem free. Housekeeping exceeded my expectations. Our room always smelled fresh and was very clean. I have stayed at expensive hotels and left unsatisfied definitely not the feeling you receive here. By the way the bottom rooms have patios that lead to the courtyard and the pool and that's definitely a plus specially if you have kids.

Summary Heading: LOVE the backyard 7 the friendly staff !!
Summary: Our party of 10 adults stayed in 5 rooms and had access to a "private backyard" that included a swimming pool and a BBQ grill.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Rooms were very comfortable, just a bit of a musty scent but nothing a few sprays of Febreeze couldn't take away.  We will definitely be back...especially with small children!  Oh, the rate was pretty reasonable to add!

Sadly, this is the type of place that could have more repeat business. But as is so common to save a few bucks they screw their own customers. The "high speed" internet is so slow it will drive you to insanity. Forget SYPE ing home to your wife, doing any online work etc. The owners chose the cheapest, slowest connection they could to save a few dollars and of course people like me who travel a LOT won't come back.  Other smaller issues, again to save money, the free breakfast is from 5:30 to 9 AM, why? So they can feed the fewest people possible and SAVE money. What about Saturday and Sunday? Nope, still 5:30 to 9 AM! When I asked about it, the desk clerk said "not very many people eat on the weekends." I wonder why. But they refuse to change the hours for the weekend. Message
Manager Response: Yes! we were upgrading the internet that day. Apologize for it but we wanted the 7 megs for faster service. It was completed the next day. sorry.

Summary Heading: Oustanding and courteous staff with the feeing of safety and comfort.
Summary: We stayed here on a Thursday and left the following Sunday. The staff was courteous, the rooms were clean, and the other guests didn't make me feel like I was in the wrong side of town. Unlike the place I went to a day previous where I swear to bob that the next room was cooking drugs or just hotboxing... anyhow, will definitely be here again soon. Thanks again guys!

Friendly Customer services. I found management staff available and willing to be of service.  This is especially important for a business - man traveling and entering and departing cities at all hours of the day... Thanks for caring and will definitely refer co-workers and colleagues traveling or visiting the area. Sincerely,  David H.
My family had a wonderful visit. I felt very comfortable staying with my children.The room was very clean and the customer service was wonderful. I felt very safe and secure.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, Professional and Clean. Overall a Great Experience.
Summary: Started off at the Motel 6 North Westminster #1137. The staff was rude, the rooms were filthy. Ater complaining, they moved us twice to another room . We had finally had enough and asked for a refund.They told us that they could not give us a refund, but could move us, once again, to another room. We decided to take our losses and leave. Thank God we found The Best Western Westminster Inn close by. The Staff was very friendly and helpfu and the room was immaculate. An excellent choice for anyone staying in the area. I give this hotel 2 thumbs up!

I had the best stay at this hotel on my business trip. It was everything and more than I had expected. It was clean, quiet and the office personal; were very helpful. Especially when I needed to know about the surrounding areas for shopping and food.

My family and I had a wonderful time staying at this hotel. The customer service was first class. I was especially impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms for the price. It's nice staying at a hotel where the customer service goes above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. Thanks to all the employees at Best Western for making our stay so enjoyable!!!!!!

This is wonderful hotel the staff is friendly and goes out of the way  to do things  you just won't expect.  I was just talking to the front desk about going to Disneyland the next day, and when we came downstairs to leave the lady at the front desk ( I believe her name was Jessica) had all the information we needed to find our way to Disneyland.  She also had information about the local resturants we could go to.  We have never experienced such thoughtful care from hotel worker.  Our stay extremely pleasent and we will return.

I stayed here for 3 nights in mid October.  This hotel is a bit on the older side, but it has been recently painted and looks good.  The beds and bedding are super comfortable and everything was very clean.  The pool is small, but surrounded by nice gardens and very peaceful.  True, you can hear the traffic from Westminster Drive, but in LA if you don't hear at least a bit of traffic noise you're either deaf or dead.  I wanted to check out some night spots in Anaheim and Fullerton, as well as go to the beach and this hotel is about 15 minutes away from everything I wanted to do, and about 45 minutes from the Airport in "average" LA traffic.  (1/3 at 75 mph, 1/3 stop and go, 1/3 at 40 mph).  There is a small convenience store across the street that is open late with a good

Summary Heading: NICE, good value, no real complaints
Summary: Average room, good FREE wireless internet.  NICE beds with comfy pillows, full range of cable tv, micro and fridge in the room.  I think because its almost in the middle of Knotts and Disney they're "overlooked" as a place to stay, but DONT do it your self.  Hot tub out side is nice, the pool is NOT heated, but its fun to watch the kid dive in the pool and freak out lol.. Breakfast is, make your own waffles, dry cereal, moo juice, oj and apple juice. Not bad, but I have had better.

Summary Heading: Sock in the bed and it wasn't ours
Summary: Checked in after midnight with family. My son found a sock in the bed when he flipped back the covers! Due to the hour, we didn't want to leave. The night manager offered us another room (which had a bad smell) and we opted to have the sheets changed. They ended up giving us a $25 credit to our room rate.  Checked out the next morning and returned to the Hampton Inn where we usually stay.

We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights while visiting family in the area.  Then we traveled up the coast for a few nights and returned to this hotel for 2 more nights before flying home. Our first room was quite nice and the price we paid was definitely worth the hotels shortcomings.  Upon our return though our 2nd room was accessed via a grungy staircase and AGAIN NO EXTRA TOWELS, even though the woman at the front desk said they'd be sent up to our room.  Can't tell you how many times we asked for extra towels but the hotel only came through once, 4 people + 3 towels = at least 1 unhappy tourist.  But when we ran out of toilet paper because the maid hadn't refilled the roll... Then I got mad.  Nice venue otherwise.  A little scrungy on the left side of the office, nicer rooms to
Absolutely no complaints here. Rooms are clean and feel newly renovated. By the looks of the pictures on-line I wasn't too hopeful, but it turned out to be quite the surprise. I will return.

The Westminster Inn was our first accommodation during our 4 week holiday of the USA (2 Adults and 2 Children).  It was very easy to locate and drive to from Los Angeles Airport (LAX) (with the aid of a TomTom GPS).  On arrival, we were quickly checked-in and provided with two electronic room keys.  Our double-queen bedroom was located on the lower (ground floor) level with a rear door leading to the pool area.  The room was clean and tidy and included a TV, wireless internet, desk, 2 chairs, fridge, coffee maker, shampoo and soap dispenser and hairdrier.  The Inn has won awards for customer service, but apart from the check-in, and requesting two more towels (as only two were originally in our room), we had no other contact with the staff so can't comment on any customer

Summary Heading: A very restful stay...Spotless,  quiet, perfect for a productive 2 day business trip!
Summary: Not too much to choose from around here. A BUNCH of budget, economy places, which are not to my taste. This place is right off the freeway, very quiet. The rooms have been redone recently, and they are very, very clean and NOT dusty. ( i have allergies) There is central Aircon, a big plus when it is really hot. I cannot stand wall mounted units, this was perfect for temp control.The room is bright and cheery. the bed was kinda new, and in great shape for a restful sleep, and all sheets seemed rather new'ish. This hotel was  about $20 more than the other hotels around, but after reading the poor comments on nearly ALL the other hotels nearby. I chose this one. I was not dissapointed at all. There was breakfast included, but i did not have (too early) and there was free

Summary Heading: Left the Motel 6 down the street and was VERY GLAD to find BW
Summary: Thank you for having clean sheets. Thank you for trying to be an environmentally sustainable property. Thank you for having good AC in the middle of a July heatwave. My sister-in-law lives down the street, and we paid only $10 more to stay here than the Motel 6. We appreciated the bonus of included breakfast and cleanliness. We rented 3 rooms over the Fourth of July and will do so when we have another family reunion. You're the best in Westminster.

The hotel rooms was very large and comfortable. There were nice employees who were very helpful and kind. There were many tourist attractions around this area. All were very close. The beach was very pleasing.
Neat small motel, a block & a half from I-405, so no highway noise, well kept, comfortable beds.  Nice pool in patio setting.   Great value.

Stayed at the hotel early July, great little hotel, the staff is very personable and helpful.  We had a room away from the pool then requested one next to the pool, no problem.  The rooms by the pool are the best, they have arcadia windows to sit by the pool.  The pool was nice, a little cool but enjoyed by my 9 year old.  The area around the pool and rooms was very nicely landscaped.   No too far from Long Beach or the the beach.  Close to Disney and other attractions. Breakfast was bagels, cereal, juice and fruit.  All fresh and plenty.   We were there during the week, so was frequented by business travelers but more families on the weekend.  All in all a great little hotel for not so much money.

Location was amazing especially as it had close proximity to the entertainment locations such as Disneyland. The service was amazing especially as the receptionists greets you as you enter and as you leave.  Also with new renovations, the hotel is very comfortable. Other entertainment is available in the hotel such as pool and television with HBO. Great for family walks.  Breakfast is healthy and delicious especially with a nutrionist background check. A very delightful stay and planning on staying for my next visit.

Summary Heading: Update of previous review -- Quality has suffered
Summary: Reportedly this property has just recently been sold and the quality of care and service has noticeably declined, although the price has gone up!  I also had an unpleasent expeirence with one of the clerks.  When I went to shower, I found no soap.  I call the desk and was told he would bring it up.  5 min later, he called and asked why I hadn't come down to pick it up.  When I walked down to get the soap (after getting dressed again) I tripped on some trash left on the stairs.  I complained about this and the soap incedent with some anger I'm afraid.  The phone rang at 6:30 the next morning.  I called the desk to see what he wanted and he said, "Why would I call you?"  He tried to keep it going later when I came by the office.  Probably just a personality problem but sure put me

This is what I would describe as a AAA 2 star hotel. It appears to be an older hotel, with some new carpeting and furnishings. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was great - close to I-405 and local businesses.  There are not really any restaurants nearby. You must drive a few miles to eat.  They advertised a continental breakfast, but it was only some packaged rolls and a gallon jug of orange juice in a very small area in the lobby itself. No bread, bagels, waffles, etc.  The room was fine - A/C worked well, internet connection worked great, comfortable bed, good TV with HBO. The wall covering was stucco-like and appeared old, but the room was very clean. Bathroom was fine and clean as well.  One drawback was the appearance of ants. They were not inside my room,
